message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.AI, cs.DC 

The paper discusses an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) designed to secure the data plane of Software Defined Networks (SDNs). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the vulnerability of networks to disruptions caused by malicious forwarding devices, which falls under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also presents a methodology that enables detecting threats autonomously, which could fall under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper discusses the potential of bringing down an entire network through compromised forwarding devices, which could fall under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper presents a trajectory-based sampling mechanism, which could fall under the category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
